content:
- 2 -
Article III, paragraph 8, should read: "The immunization of all children entering the recommended age group at . 6 months of age and their reimmunization with a booster dose of 1.0 cc. between 4 and 6 years of age will be . made a permanent feature of the Taiwan provincial health services."
Article III, paragraph 9: .
On the original plan, Items (a) through (e) have been com- pleted. In September, 1954, the first vaccine was tested in a pilot project, the tests being completed satisfactorily by mid-October. Immunizations are beginning in November in ten provincial hospitals and will be extended through 365 health stations beginning about 1 February 1955, after the smallpox vaccination campaign has been completed.
0024
The Government, the Organization and UNICEF further agree that:
1. Each batch of vaccine should be tested for potency.
2. Reliable statistics are required for evaluation purposes, and the Government agrees to submit to the Organization on request such statistics as are agreed between the Government and the Organization.
In Taipei on
For the Goverment of the Republic of China
In Manila on
For the World Health Organization
In Taipei on
For the United Nations Children's Fund
Taipoi, November 17, 1954.
國史饭 Academia Historica
26

cells.content: For the Goverment of the Republic of China

paragraphs.content: Article III, paragraph 8, should read: "The immunization of all children entering the recommended age group at . 6 months of age and their reimmunization with a booster dose of 1.0 cc. between 4 and 6 years of age will be . made a permanent feature of the Taiwan provincial health services."

On the original plan, Items (a) through (e) have been com- pleted. In September, 1954, the first vaccine was tested in a pilot project, the tests being completed satisfactorily by mid-October. Immunizations are beginning in November in ten provincial hospitals and will be extended through 365 health stations beginning about 1 February 1955, after the smallpox vaccination campaign has been completed.
The Government, the Organization and UNICEF further agree that:
1. Each batch of vaccine should be tested for potency.

2. Reliable statistics are required for evaluation purposes, and the Government agrees to submit to the Organization on request such statistics as are agreed between the Government and the Organization.
For the Goverment of the Republic of China
For the United Nations Children's Fund
